question: ほど
sourceMnemonic:
The kanji and the word are exactly the same. That means they share meanings as well.

Note that <ja>程</ja> is a word that works in conjunction with other words or phrases to express the extent, degree, amount, or time related to a particular action or event.
sourceReadingMnemonic: You'll remember this kanji to the <vocabulary>extent</vocabulary> that you study it. If you study it like <reading>Hodo</reading>r (<ja>ほど</ja>) would study it, you won't learn it at all. You would only be able to say "hodor, hodor," over and over again, which isn't helpful at all.
references: Cure Dolly: くらい (kurai) VS ほど (hodo) What they mean and why they mean it. - YouTube
